greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Minimal common difference of maximal arithmetic progression starting at n such that each term k has tau(k)=tau(n)
comment: a(1) is not well defined, since the maximal progression has only one term.
example: For n=6, A165500(n)=3, and the least difference d such that tau(6) = tau(6+d) = tau(6+2d) is d=2, so a(6)=2.
results.author: _Hugo van der Sanden_, Sep 21 2009, Oct 09 2009
ext: Extended to n=22 taking advantage of A088430 for n=19, _Hugo van der Sanden_, Jun 02 2015
